results.title: Il Est Minuit, Docteur Schweitzer
results.brief_description:
This biopic of Albert Schweitzer follows the young graduate of Medical school all the way to Gabon where he sets up a dispensary with the help of nurse Marie Winter. Their effort are interrupted with the onset of World War I as Albert realises he is a German citizen established in a French colony. See also: ‘Le Grand Blanc de Lambarene’(NLA #2108812, VHS).

Credits: Producer, Georges Bernier ; director, Andre Haguet ; writers, Andre Haguet, Henri-Andre Legrand ; photography, Lucien Joulin ; music, Maurice-Paul Guillot.
Cast: Pierre Fresnay, Jeanne Moreau, Raymond Rouleau, Jany Vallieres, Jean Debucourt.

results.title: I, the Aboriginal
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Kip Porteous and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Set in and around Darwin the film discloses the life of an Australian First Nations man as depicted in Douglas Lockwood’s book of the same name. Philip Roberts recalls his early years of tribal life and gradual acceptance by the white community. He receives medical training, and travels frequently to his own people making use of his knowledge.

results.title: Henry Ford's America
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Wright, Donald Brittain, Roman Kroitor and Janet Leissner
results.brief_description: An inside look at the workings of the Ford Motor Company. Traces the history of the company using historical footage, and interviews with Henry Ford II and other company executives. Looks at the developing role of the car within American society. Script, Donald Brittain. Editing, Rosemarie Shapely and Les Halman. Images, Andreas Poulsson. Music, Art Phillips.

results.title: Hello London
results.creator_credit: George Fowler, Kinran and Sidney Smith
results.brief_description: Musical film starring Olympic gold medalist and world famous ice-skater, Sonja Henie, and co-starring Michael Wilding with Stanley Holloway. Light-hearted song and dance film on ice set in London. The cast, including Sonja, all play under their own names.

results.title: Heatwave
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Ross Matthews, Hilary Linstead and Heatwave Films Pty Ltd, Sydney Australia F F P A A
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller about a woman who cared too much about people, their lives and their homes, and a man who had a job to do and wouldn’t be swayed by emotions. She represented the people, he represented power and corruption and together they were heading towards trouble. Cast includes Judy Davis, Richard Moir, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter and John Meillon. PLEASE NOTE: THE 16MM PRINT OF THIS FILM HAS NORWEGIAN SUBTITLES

results.title: Harmony Row
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and Frank Thring
results.brief_description: This production stars George Wallace as a policeman who is assigned to Harmony Row, a notorious haunt of thugs and criminals. On the beat he makes many friends and is finally persuaded to fight Slogger Lee, the biggest trouble maker in Harmony Row, in a boxing tournament.

results.title: Happy together
results.creator_credit: Block 2 Pictures, Prenom H, Seowoo, Jet Tone Production and Wong
results.brief_description: ‘Happy Together’ is a melancholy and bleak reflection on love and loneliness from acclaimed director Wong Kar-Wai. At the film’s centre is the strained romantic relationship between two men from Hong Kong who travel to South America in hope of a reconciliation. Soon enough they break up during an aborted road trip to Iguazu Falls, with both men deciding to stay on in Buenos Aires. Though they each begin separate lives, the couple retains a powerful, if reluctant connection, and when one falls victim to a harsh beating, the couple reunites, though only briefly. The film focuses almost exclusively upon the dance of alienation and togetherness behind this tumultuous relationship, with spectacular cinematography by Christopher Doyle. In Cantonese, Mandarin and Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Greenkeeping
results.creator_credit: Glenys Rowe, Central Park Films and David Caesar
results.brief_description: One thing after another seems to have gone wrong for the not so bright greenkeeper Lenny (Mark Little). In his professional life he has to contend with brown grass, in his personal life his dope smoking wife (Lisa Hensley) is running up debts with her dealers. He tries to secure the affections of a waitress at the bowling club, but like most other aspects of his life, he lucks out. Things reach a crisis point when Lenny’s lack of greenkeeping skills could result in a loss for the club at the forthcoming Pennant Day. Director David Caesar’s first feature reflects a nostalgia for a simpler time and place.

results.title: Great Cognito
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton Productions and Will Vinton
results.brief_description: The most recent Will Vinton clay animated production introduces the Great Cognito a talented impersonator who really throws himself into his work. Accompanying his visual metamorphoses with a rapid-fire commentary, he entertains his audience with hilarious impersonations of public figures.

results.title: Gorillas in the Mist: The Story of Dian Fossey
results.creator_credit: Terence A. Clegg, Arne Glimcher, Guber-Peters Company and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of anthropologist Dian Fossey who travels to the African mountains to study the rare gorillas. Her interest in the mountain gorillas becomes an obsession and she risks her life to protect them from poachers and animal traders and ultimate extinction. Stars Sigourney Weaver and Bryan Brown.
